channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report X-2024040837
item.description:
Report X-2024040837

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought package to QA and said it was leaking. He said it must have tipped over when he turned a corner. After inspecting the package it was determined that the leaking came from the vent in the lid. After inspecting the package it was taken to the HAZMAT cage and placed in a hazmat drum. DescribePack: The package leaked out of the vent in the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package remained outside for adequate ventilation and was placed right side up so it would not leak anymore.

item.title: Report X-2024040814
item.description:
Report X-2024040814

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the back of truck was opened, package was on its side and the box was wet. The package was taken out of the truck and placed right side up. I then looked at the other packages around it and determined that nothing else was wet. DescribePack: One gallon inside the box had a loose lid and being on its side caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed right side up and taken to the Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024040320
item.description:
Report E-2024040320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 4, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 115-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted roadway/trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. HCE utilized an additional tote to complete a gravity feed from the impacted 275-gallon tote. All spent absorbents, absorbent pads and collected waste were collected and containerized into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums and PPE was containerized into a separate 55-gallon open top poly drum. All were labeled and set aside for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040480
item.description:
Report X-2024040480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded into vehicle for delivery, during transit box tipped over, driver noticed package was wet and brought back to warehouse. DescribePack: When package was opened there was a loose cap on one gallon. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When driver brought package back, opened package and tightened cap on bottle that was loose.
